           <dt>pa 1</dt>
           <dd><em>pa</em> the first labial consonant</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; pak&#x0101;ra </dt>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;varga</em> m. 'the <em>p</em> series', the labial series of consonants</dd>

           <dd><em>pa</em> mf(<em>p&#x0101;</em> and <em>p&#x012b;</em>)n. (&#x221a;1. <em>p&#x0101;</em>) drinking (cf. <em>a&#x1e43;hri-</em>, <em>aneka-</em> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also <em>paka</em> in <em>taila-paka</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. or (<em>p&#x0101;</em>) f. the act of drinking L</dd>

           <dt>pa 3</dt>
           <dd><em>pa</em> mfn. (&#x221a;3. <em>p&#x0101;</em>) guarding, protecting, ruling (ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>aja-</em>, <em>kula-</em> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also <em>paka</em> in <em>hasti-paka</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. guarding, protecting L</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; quantity ( See <em>ke&#x015b;a-</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of two cases or one side of an argument, an alternative (<em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;e</em>, 'on the other hand', with <em>atra</em>, 'in this case', <em>pak&#x1e63;&#x00e2;ntare</em>, 'in the other case') P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Sch </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; any supposition or view, motion, idea, opinion (<em>mukhya&#x1e25; pak&#x1e63;a&#x1e25;</em>, 'an excellent idea' &#x015a;ak. Sch.) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>pac 1</dt>
           <dd><em>pac</em> or <em>pa&#x00f1;c</em>, cl. 1, P. &#x0100;. <em>pacati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, or <em>pa&#x00f1;cati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to spread out, make clear or evident Dh&#x0101;tup. vi, 14: Caus. <em>-pa&#x00f1;cayati</em> (xxxii, 108), See <em>pra-pa&#x00f1;caya</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; pa&#x00f1;ca 1</dt>
           <dd><em>pa&#x00f1;ca</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. spread out Uttarar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (in music) a kind of measure</dd>

           <dt>pac 2</dt>
           <dd><em>pac</em> cl. P. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiii, 27) <em>p&#x00e1;cati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (cl. 4. &#x0100;. <em>p&#x00e1;cyate</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#below">below.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>pac&#x0101;na</em> MBh. iii, 13239 [cf. <em>kim-pac&#x0101;na</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>pap&#x0101;ca</em> [2. sg. <em>papaktha</em> or <em>pecitha</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-4, 121 Sch.], <em>pecur</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pece</em>, <em>pecire</em> [<em>&#x00e1;peciran</em>, i AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>peciran</em> Pat. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-4, 120] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>p&#x00e1;k&#x1e63;at</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ap&#x0101;k&#x1e63;&#x012b;t</em>, <em>apakta</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>pacy&#x0101;t</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>pak&#x1e63;yati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> or <em>pakt&#x0101;</em> Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>paktv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> AV. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>p&#x00e1;ktave</em> AV. Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>paktum</em>, <em>p&#x0101;&#x1e47;</em> viii, 2, 30 Sch.), to cook, bake, roast, boil (&#x0100;. also 'for one's self') RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with double acc.) to cook anything out of (e.g. <em>tandul&#x0101;n odanam pacati</em>, 'he cooks porridge out of rice-grains') Siddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to bake or burn (bricks) &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to digest Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to ripen, mature, bring to perfection or completion RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with double acc.) to develop or change into (e.g. <em>pu&#x1e47;y&#x00e2;pu&#x1e47;ya&#x1e43; sukh&#x00e2;sukham</em>, 'merit and demerit into weal or woe') Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (intrans.) to become ripe or mature Bhpr.: Pass. <em>pacy&#x00e1;te</em> (<em>&#x25cb;ti</em> MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ap&#x0101;ci</em> Gr.), to be cooked or burnt or melted or digested or ripened or developed RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be tormented Divy&#x00e2;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also intrans. = <em>p&#x00e1;cyate</em> (cf.above), to become ripe or mature, to develop or ripen RV. VS. Br. (with acc. of the fruit that is borne or ripens Maitr. K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-1, 87 V&#x0101;rtt. 14 Pat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>lok&#x00e1;&#x1e25; p&#x00e1;cyam&#x0101;na&#x1e25;</em>, 'the developing world' &#x015a;Br.): Caus. <em>p&#x0101;cayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> Br. (aor. <em>ap&#x012b;pacat</em> Gr </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x0101;pacyate</em>, to be much cooked, to cook very much or burn excessively, to be much afflicted BhP.            <dt>pat 2</dt>
           <dd><em>pat</em> cl. 1. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xx, 15) <em>p&#x00e1;tati</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>pap&#x0101;ta</em>, <em>paptim&#x00e1;</em>, <em>pet&#x00e1;tur</em>, <em>papt&#x00fa;r</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-p&#x00e1;tya</em> or <em>-p&#x0101;&#x0341;tam</em> Br.), to fly, soar, rush on RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fall down or off, alight, descend (with acc. or loc.), fall or sink (with or without <em>adhas</em> or <em>narake</em>, 'to go down to hell' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>cara&#x1e47;au</em> or <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e47;ayo&#x1e25;</em>, 'to fall at a person's feet') Mn. MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fall (in a moral sense), lose caste or rank or position ChUp. Mn. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to fall or get into or among (loc.) Kath&#x0101;s. Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to occur, come to pass, happen Pa&#x00f1;c.: Caus. <em>pat&#x00e1;yati</em>, to fly or move rapidly along RV. VS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to speed (trans </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>patay&#x00e1;t</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x0101;t&#x00e1;yati</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ap&#x012b;patat</em> AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>p&#x0101;tyate</em> MBh. &amp;c.), to let fly or cause to fall, to fling, hurl, throw AV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to lay low, bring down (lit. and fig.), overthrow, ruin, destroy MBh. R. &amp;c. to throw upon or in, lay on (loc.) K&#x0101;v. Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with or scil. <em>&#x0101;tm&#x0101;nam</em>) to throw one's self MBh. M&#x1e5b;icch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cut off (a head) Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to knock out (teeth) BhP </dd>

           <dt>pati 1</dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x00e1;ti</em> m. (cf. &#x221a;1. <em>vat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; when uncompounded and meaning 'husband', instr. <em>p&#x00e1;tya</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; dat. <em>p&#x00e1;tye</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gen. abl. <em>p&#x00e1;tyur</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; loc. <em>p&#x00e1;tyau</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but when meaning 'lord, master', and ifc. regularly inflected with exceptions </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-4, 8 ; 9) a master, owner, possessor, lord, ruler, sovereign RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a husband ib. (in comp. either with the stem or with the gen., e.g. <em>duhit&#x1e5b;-p&#x25cb;</em> or &#x25cb;tuH-p&#x25cb; P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-3, 24 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; when mfn. f. = m. e.g. <em>-j&#x012b;vat-paty&#x0101; tvay&#x0101;</em> R. ii, 24, 8, or <em>patik&#x0101;</em> e.g. <em>pram&#x012b;ta-patik&#x0101;</em> Mn. ix, 68) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of the 2 entities (with <em>p&#x0101;&#x015b;upat&#x00e1;s</em>) RTL. 89 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a &#x221a;L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. a female possessor, mistress P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-1, 33 Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a wife (<em>v&#x1e5b;ddha-p&#x25cb;</em> = <em>-patn&#x012b;</em>, the wife of an old man ib. 34 Sch.) [Cf. Gk. ?, 'husband' ; [582, 1] Lat. <em>potis</em>, <em>pos-sum</em> for <em>potis-sum</em> ; Lith. <em>patis</em>, 'husband' ; Goth. (<em>bruth-</em>) <em>faths</em>, 'bridegroom']</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; pati&#x1e43;var&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x1e43;-var&#x0101;</em> f. a woman who chooses her husband for herself (cf. <em>svaya&#x1e43;-vara</em>) Ragh. R&#x0101;jat</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; patik&#x0101;ma </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; pada </dt>
           <dd><em>pad&#x00e1;</em> n. (rarely m.) a step, pace, stride </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a footstep, trace, vestige, mark, the foot itself. RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>padena</em>, on foot </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pade pade</em>, at every step, everywhere, on every occasion </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>tr&#x012b;&#x1e47;i pad&#x0101;ni vi&#x1e63;&#x1e47;o&#x1e25;</em>, the three steps or footprints of Vish&#x1e47;u [i.e. the earth, the air, and the sky </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> i, 154, 5 Vikr. i, 19], also N. of a constellation or according to some 'the space between the eyebrows' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sg. <em>vi&#x1e63;&#x1e47;o&#x1e25; padam</em>, N. of a locality </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pada&#x1e43;-&#x221a;d&#x0101;</em>, <em>pad&#x0101;t pada&#x1e43;-&#x221a;gam</em> or &#x221a;<em>cal</em>, to make a step move on </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pada&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, with loc. to set foot in or on, to enter </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>m&#x016b;rdhni</em>, to set the foot upon the head of <em>gen.</em> i.e. overcome </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>citte</em> or <em>h&#x1e5b;daye</em>, to take possession of any one's heart or mind </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with loc. or <em>prati</em>, to have dealings with <em>pada&#x1e43; ni-&#x221a;dh&#x0101;</em> with loc., to set foot in = to make impression upon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>padavy&#x0101;m</em>, to set the foot on a person's <em>gen. or ibc.</em> track, to emulate or equal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>padam ni-&#x221a;bandh</em> with loc., to enter or engage in) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sign, token, characteristic MBh. Kath&#x0101;s. Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a footing, standpoint </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; position rank station, site, abode, home RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>padam &#x0101;-&#x221a;tan</em>, to spread or extend one's position </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pad&#x0101;t padam bhr&#x0101;mayitv&#x0101;</em>, having caused to wander from place to place) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a business affair, matter, object or cause of (gen. or comp.) K&#x0101;v. Pa&#x00f1;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a pretext L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a part, portion, division (cf. <em>dvi-</em>, <em>tri-</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a square on a chess-board R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a plot of ground Inscr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the foot as a measure of length (= 12 or 15 fingers' breadth, or 1/2 or 1/3 or 3/7 of a Prakrama) K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a ray of light (m. L.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a portion of a verse, quarter or line of a stanza RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a word or an inflected word or the stem of a noun in the middle cases and before some Taddhitas P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 14 &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p583-2"></a>[Page 583, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>pada-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha</em> Pr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; common N. of the P. and &#x0100;. Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any one in a set of numbers the sum of which is required </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a period in an arithmetical progression Col </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a square &#x221a;S&#x016b;ryas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a quadrant ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; protection L. [Cf. Gk. ? ; [583, 2] Lat. <em>peda</em> ; <em>op-pidum</em> for <em>op-pedum</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; padakamala </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kamala</em> n. a lotus-like foot L</dd>

           <dt>padma </dt>
           <dd><em>padma</em> m. n. (2. or 3. <em>pad</em>?) a lotus (esp. the flower of the lotus-plant Nelumbium Speciosum which closes towards evening </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often confounded with the water-lily or Nymphaea Alba) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the form or figure of a lotus R. M&#x0101;rkP. (a N. given by the T&#x0101;ntrikas to the 6 divisions of the upper part of the body called Cakras, q.v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. mark or mole on the human body R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; red or coloured marks on the face or trunk of an elephant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. part of a column or pillar Var </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of temple ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an army arrayed in the form of a lotus Mn. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. posture of the body in religious meditation, Ved&#x00e2;nt. (cf. <em>padm&#x00e2;sana</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of coitus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of the 9 treasures of Kubera (also personified) R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of the 8 treasures connected with the magical art called Padmin&#x012b; MBh. Hariv. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. high number (1000 millions or billions) MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. constellation Var </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a partic. cold hell Buddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. fragrant substance MBh. (v&#x1e37;. <em>&#x25cb;maka</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a species of bdellium L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; m. a species of plant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an elephant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of serpent Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of R&#x0101;ma (son of Da&#x015b;a-ratha) &#x015a;atr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of two serpent-demons MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of one of the attendants of Skanda MBh </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. 'the lotus-hued one', N. of &#x015a;r&#x012b; Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (cf. <em>padma-&#x015b;r&#x012b;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of plant Su&#x015b;r. (Clerodendrum Siphorantus or Hibiscus Mutabilis L.) </dd>

           <dt>para 1</dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x00e1;ra</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (&#x221a;1. <em>p&#x1e5b;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; abl. sg. m. n. <em>p&#x00e1;rasm&#x0101;t</em>, <em>&#x25cb;r&#x0101;t</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; loc. <em>p&#x00e1;rasmin</em>, <em>&#x25cb;re</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; nom. pl. m. <em>p&#x00e1;re</em>, <em>&#x25cb;r&#x0101;s</em>, <em>&#x25cb;r&#x0101;sas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-1, 34 ; vii, 1, 16 ; 50) far, distant, remote (in space), opposite, ulterior, farther than, beyond, on the other or farther side of, extreme </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; previous (in time), former </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ancient, past </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; later, future, next </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; following, succeeding, subsequent </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; final, last </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exceeding (in number or degree), more than </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; better or worse than, superior or inferior to, best or worst, highest, supreme, chief (in the compar. meanings [where also <em>-tara</em>], with abl., rarely gen. or ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; exceptionally <em>para&#x1e43; &#x015b;atam</em>, more than a hundred, lit. 'an excessive hundred, a hundred with a surplus' R. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p586-2"></a>[Page 586, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>par&#x0101;&#x1e25; ko&#x1e6d;aya&#x1e25;</em> Prab. Hcat.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; strange, foreign, alien, adverse, hostile ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; other than, different from (abl.) Prab </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; left, remaining Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; concerned or anxious for (loc.) R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. another (different from one's self), a foreigner, enemy, foe, adversary RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a following letter or sound (only ifc. mfn. e.g. <em>ta-para</em>, having <em>t</em> as the following letter, followed by <em>t</em>) RPr&#x0101;t. P&#x0101;&#x1e47; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (scil. <em>graha</em>) a subsidiary Soma-graha TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a king of Kosala with the patr. &#x0100;&#x1e6d;&#x1e47;&#x0101;ra Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of another king MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Samara Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (sc. <em>pr&#x0101;s&#x0101;da</em>) of the palace of Mitravind&#x0101; ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. or n. the Supreme or Absolute Being, the Universal Soul Up. R. Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a foreign country, abroad (?) Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of plant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a sound in the first of its 4 stages L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. measure of time S&#x0101;y </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a river MBh. VP. (v&#x1e37;. <em>p&#x0101;r&#x0101;</em>, <em>ve&#x1e47;&#x0101;</em>, <em>ve&#x1e47;&#x1e47;&#x0101;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a goddess (cf. s.v.), n. remotest distance MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; highest point or degree ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; final beatitude L. (also <em>-taram</em> and <em>par&#x0101;t para-taram</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the number 10, 000, 000, 000 (as the full age of Brahm&#x0101;) VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of partic. S&#x0101;mans K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any chief matter or paramount object (ifc. [f. <em>&#x0101;</em>] having as the chief object, given up to, occupied with, engrossed in, intent upon, resting on, consisting of, serving for, synonymous with &amp;c. MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the wider or mare extended or remoter meaning of a word Jaim. Kull </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in logic) genus </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; existence (regarded as the common property of all things) W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. afterwards, later </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with abl.) beyond, after (e.g. <em>para&#x1e43; vij&#x00f1;&#x0101;n&#x0101;t</em>, beyond human knowledge </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>astam-ay&#x0101;t p&#x25cb;</em>, after sunset </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>matta&#x1e25; p&#x25cb;</em>, after me </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ata&#x1e25; p&#x25cb;</em> or <em>param ata&#x1e25;</em>, after this, farther on, hereafter, next </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ita&#x1e25; p&#x25cb;</em>, henceforward, from now </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>tata&#x1e25; p&#x25cb;</em> or <em>tata&#x015b; ca p&#x25cb;</em>, after that, thereupon </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>n&#x00e2;sm&#x0101;t p&#x25cb;</em> [for <em>m&#x00e2;sm"&#x1e63;p&#x25cb;</em>], no more of this, enough) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in a high degree, excessively, greatly, completely ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rather, most willingly, by all means ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; I will, so be it Divy&#x00e2;v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the most, at the utmost, merely, no more than, nothing but ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but, however, otherwise (<em>para&#x1e43; tu</em> or <em>para&#x1e43; ki&#x1e43; tu</em> id </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yadi p&#x25cb;</em>, if at all, perhaps, at any rate </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na-p&#x25cb;</em>, not-but </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na para&#x1e43;-api</em>, not only-but also </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x1e6d;para&#x1e43; na-api na</em>, not only not-but not even </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na para&#x1e43;-y&#x0101;vat</em>, not only-but even) ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>p&#x00e1;re&#x1e47;a</em>), ind. farther, beyond, past (with acc.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; thereupon, afterwards, later than, after (with abl.or gen.). Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>par&#x00e9;</em>), ind. later, farther, in future, afterwards RV. MBh. K&#x0101;v. [Cf. Zd. <em>para</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>peren-die</em> ; Goth. [586, 2] <em>fa&#x00ed;rra</em> ; Germ. <em>fern</em> ; Eng. <em>far</em> and <em>fore</em>.]</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; past, completed (in a partic. sense, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#below">below.</a> and K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-2, 115) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ibc.) in an invisible or imperceptible manner (cf. below) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. out of sight, behind one's back, in the absence or without the knowledge of (instr </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e&#x1e47;a</em>), ind. out of sight, secretly, mysteriously Br. Up </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;t</em>), ind. secretly, without the knowledge of (instr.) Br. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p589-2"></a>[Page 589, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e</em>), ind. behind the back of (gen.) M&#x1e5b;icch. Pa&#x00f1;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one's self not being present P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-2, 115 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. an ascetic L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of Anu BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. (sc. <em>v&#x1e5b;tti</em>) a past or completed action APr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (sc. <em>vibhakti</em>) a termination of the perfect tense K&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a river VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x0101;ma</em> (<em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;&#x00e1;-</em>), mfn. liking what is secret or mysterious &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x1e5b;ta</em> mfn. (a hymn) in which a deity is not addressed but only spoken of in the 3rd person Nir. vii, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-jit</em> mfn. victorious in an imperceptible manner BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x0101;</em> f. (MBh.), <em>-tva</em> n. (Ved&#x00e2;ntas.) invisibility, imperceptibility </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-p&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha</em> m. a partic. P&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e6d;hya &#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-priya</em> mfn. = <em>-k&#x0101;ma</em> AitBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bandhu</em> (<em>par&#x00f4;k&#x1e63;a-</em>), mfn. not clear in its relation MaitrS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-buddhi</em> mfn. regarding as something distant, indifferent to, J&#x0101;takam </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhoga</em> m. enjoyment or possession of anything in the proprietor's absence W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-manmatha</em> mfn. inexperienced in love &#x015a;ak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-v&#x1e5b;tti</em> mfn. living out of sight K&#x0101;m </dd>

           <dt>pari </dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x00e1;ri</em> ind. round, around, about, round about </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fully, abundantly, richly (esp. ibc. [where also <em>par&#x012b;</em>] to express fulness or high degree) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as a prep. (with acc.) about (in space and time) RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; against, opposite to, in the direction of, towards, to ib. (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 90 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also at the beginning of a comp. mfn </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> ii, 2, 18 V&#x0101;rtt. 4 Pat. and <em>pary-adhyayana</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; beyond, more than AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to the share of (with &#x221a;<em>as</em>, or <em>bh&#x016b;</em>, to fall to a person's lot) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 90 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; successively, severally (e.g. <em>v&#x1e5b;k&#x1e63;am pari si&#x00f1;cati</em>, he waters tree after tree) ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with abl.) from, away from, out of RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 93) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; outside of, except P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 88 K&#x0101;&#x015b;. (often repeated ib. viii, 1, 5 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also at the beginning or the end of an ind. comp. ib. ii, 1, 12) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; after the lapse of Mn.iii, 119 MBh. xiii, 4672 (some read <em>parisa&#x1e43;vatsar&#x0101;t</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in consequence or on account or for the sake of RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to (esp. <em>dh&#x00e1;rma&#x1e47;as p&#x00e1;ri</em>, according to ordinance or in conformity with law or right) RV. [Cf. Zd. <em>pairi</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ?.] [591, 2]</dd>

           <dt>pariv&#x1e5b;t </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>-v&#x1e5b;tya</em>, or <em>par&#x012b;-vartam</em>), to turn round, revolve, move in a circle or to and fro, roll or wheel or wander about, circumambulate (acc.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to be reborn in (loc.) VP </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to abide, stay, remain Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to act, proceed, behave R.: Caus. <em>-vartayati</em>, to cause to turn or move round or back or to and fro MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;.) to roll or bring near (Subj. <em>-vartay&#x0101;te</em>) RV. v, 37, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to overthrow, upset (a carriage) Hariv </dd>

           <dd><em>pari-h&#x0101;ra</em> (<em>p&#x00e1;ri-</em>), m. leading round K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; delivering or handing over Ny&#x0101;yam. Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; shunning, avoiding, excluding, abandoning, giving up, resigning &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; leaving out, omission S&#x0101;h </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (in dram.) remedying or atoning for any improper action S&#x0101;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an extraordinary grant, exemption from taxes, immunity Mn. R. M&#x0101;rkP. R&#x0101;jat </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; 2. <em>-vat</em> ind. (ifc.) like the omission of S&#x0101;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-vi&#x015b;uddhi</em> f. (with Jainas) purification by such mortification and penance as are enjoined by the example of ancient saints or sages W </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; pary&#x0101;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>pary-&#x0101;ya</em> m. going or turning or winding round, revolving, revolution K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; course, lapse, expiration of time MBh. Hariv. Vet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; regular recurrence, repetition, succession, turn (ibc. or <em>e&#x1e47;a</em>, ind. in turn, successively, alternately </dd>

           <dt>pallava 1</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. method of reciting the text of the Veda (of which there are 5, viz. Sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;, Pada, Krama, Ja&#x1e6d;&#x0101; and Ghana <strong>RTL. 409)</strong> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; the reading (of a text) Naish. Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>dh&#x0101;tu-p&#x00e2;&#x1e6d;ha</em> Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. Clypea Hernandifolia L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; p&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini </dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini</em> m. (according to P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-1, 95 patr. fr. <em>p&#x0101;&#x1e47;ina</em>) N. of the most eminent of all native Sansk&#x1e5b;it grammarians (he was the author of the <em>a&#x1e63;t&#x00e2;dhy&#x0101;y&#x012b;</em> and supposed author of sev. other works, viz. the Dh&#x0101;tu-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha, Ga&#x1e47;a-p&#x0101;tha, Li&#x1e45;g&#x00e2;nu&#x015b;&#x0101;sana and &#x015a;iksh&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he was a G&#x0101;ndh&#x0101;ra and a native of Sal&#x0101;tura, situated in the North-West near Attok and Peshawar [see iv, 3, 94 and &#x015a;&#x0101;l&#x0101;tur&#x012b;ya] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he lived after Gautama Buddha but B.C. and is regarded as an inspired Muni </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his grandfather's name was Devala and his mother's D&#x0101;kshi <em>see s.v. and &#x1e0d;aksheya</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a poet (by some identified with the grammarian)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>garbhasya</em>) fall of the fetus, miscarriage Su&#x015b;r </dd>

           <dd><em>pitu&#x1e25;-putra</em> &amp;c. See under <em>pit&#x1e5b;</em></dd>

           <dt>pit&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>pit&#x1e5b;&#x0301;</em> in. (irreg. acc. pl. <em>pitaras</em> MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gen. pl. <em>pitri&#x1e47;&#x0101;m</em> BhP.) a father RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (in the Veda N. of B&#x1e5b;ihas-pati, Varu&#x1e47;a, Praj&#x0101;-pati, and esp. of heaven or the sky </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>antar&#x0101; pitara&#x1e43; m&#x0101;tara&#x1e43; ca</em>, 'between heaven and earth' RV. x, 88, 15) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. du. (<em>&#x25cb;tarau</em>) father and mother, parents RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (in the Veda N. of the Ara&#x1e47;is <em>q.v.</em> and of heaven and earth) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. (<em>&#x25cb;taras</em>) the fathers, forefathers, ancestors, (esp.) the Pit&#x1e5b;is or deceased ancestors (they are of 2 classes, viz. the deceased father, grandfathers and great-grandfathers of any partic. person, and the progenitors of mankind generally </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in honour of both these classes rites called Sr&#x0101;ddhas are performed and oblations called Pi&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;as <em>q.v.</em> are presented </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they inhabit a peculiar region, which, according to some, is the Bhuvas ar region of the air, according to others, the orbit of the moon, and are considered as the regents of the Nakshatras Magh&#x0101; and M&#x016b;la </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RTL">RTL.</a> 10 &amp;c.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a father and his brothers, father and uncles, paternal ancestors Mn. ii, 151 &amp;c. R. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. child's-demon Su&#x015b;r. [Origin fr. &#x221a;3 <em>p&#x0101;</em> very doubtful ; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>pita</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>pater</em>, <em>&#x00f1;up-piter</em> ; Goth. [626, 2] <em>fadar</em> ; Germ. <em>Vater</em> ; Eng. <em>father</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; pi&#x015b;&#x0101;ca </dt>
           <dd><em>pi&#x015b;&#x0101;c&#x00e1;</em> m. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) N. of a class of demons (possibly so called either from their fondness for flesh [<em>pi&#x015b;a</em> for <em>pi&#x015b;ita</em>] or from their yellowish appearance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they were perhaps originally a personification of the ignis fat&#x016b;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; they are mentioned in the Veda along with Asuras and R&#x0101;kshasas, See also Mn. xii, 44 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in later times they are the children of Krodh&#x0101;, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 276) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a fiend, ogre, demon, imp, malevolent or devilish being AV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (ifc. 'a devil of a -' K&#x0101;d.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Rakshas R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. N. of a daughter of Daksha and mother of the Pi&#x015b;&#x0101;cas VP </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; excessive fondness for (ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. <em>&#x0101;yudha-p&#x25cb;</em>, excessive fondness for fighting) B&#x0101;lar. Anarghar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of Valerian L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Yogini Hcat</dd>

           <dt>put </dt>
           <dd><em>put</em> or <em>pud</em> (a word invented to explain <em>putra</em> or <em>put-tra</em>, See Mn. ix, 138, and <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Nir">Nir.</a> ii, 11), hell or a partic. hell (to which the childless are condemned) MBh.: K&#x0101;v. and C. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p632-3"></a>[Page 632, Column 3]</font>

           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of metre Col. (prob. w&#x1e5b;. for <em>pu&#x1e6d;a</em>, cf. <em>&#x015b;r&#x012b;-pu&#x1e6d;a</em>)</dd>

           <dt>puttala </dt>
           <dd><em>puttala</em> m. (prob. fr. <em>putra</em>) a puppet, doll, small statue, effigy, image (<em>-dahana</em> n. <em>-vidh&#x0101;na</em> n. and <em>-vidhi</em> m. burning an effigy in place of the body of one who has died abroad) Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. = m </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an idol </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;l&#x012b;-c&#x0101;lana</em> n. a partic. game with dolls Gal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;l&#x012b;-p&#x016b;j&#x0101;</em> f. idol-worship, idolatry MW</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; puttalaka </dt>
           <dd><em>puttalaka</em> m. (and <em>ik&#x0101;</em> f.) = <em>puttala</em>, <em>&#x25cb;l&#x012b;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;liko</em> <em>vidhi&#x1e25;</em> = <em>puttala-v&#x25cb;</em> above</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; puttik&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>puttik&#x0101;</em> f. a doll, puppet BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the white ant or termite (so called from its doll-like form) Mn. MBh. Pa&#x00f1;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>pata&#x1e43;gik&#x0101;</em>, a small kind of bee Bhpr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a gnat N&#x012b;lak. = <em>plu&#x1e63;i</em> &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k. S&#x0101;y</dd>

           <dt>putra </dt>
           <dd><em>putr&#x00e1;</em> m. (etym. doubtful, perhaps fr. &#x221a;2. <em>pu&#x1e63;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; traditionally said to be a comp. <em>put-tra</em>, 'preserving from the hell called Put' Mn. ix, 138) a son, child RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (also the young of an animal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 8-1, 15 Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. it forms diminutives, cf. <em>d&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;at-p&#x25cb;</em> and <em>&#x015b;il&#x0101;-p&#x25cb;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; voc. sg. du. pl. often used to address young persons, my son, my children &amp;c.' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; du. 'two sons' or, a son and a daughter' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-2, 68) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of small venomous animal (= <em>putraka</em>) Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in astrol.) N. of the fifth house Var </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of Brahmish&#x1e6d;ha Ragh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Priya-vrata VP. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a daughter MBh. Hariv. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a doll or puppet ( See <em>d&#x0101;ru-putr&#x012b;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. used to form diminutives ( See <em>asi-putr&#x012b;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of plant L. ; N. of P&#x0101;rvati L. [Cf. Zd. <em>puthra</em> ; Gk. ? and Lat. <em>puer</em> (?).] [632, 3]</dd>

           <dt>punar </dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x00fa;nar</em> ind. back, home, in an opposite direction RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (with &#x221a;1. <em>gam</em>, <em>y&#x0101;</em>, to go back or away </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with &#x221a;<em>d&#x0101;</em>, to give back, restore </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with &#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>, to turn round </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with &#x221a;<em>as</em> and dat., to fall back upon) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; again, once more (also with <em>bh&#x016b;yas</em>) ib. (with &#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>, to exist again, be renewed, become a wife again, re= marry) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; again and again, repeatedly ib. (mostly <em>p&#x00fa;na&#x1e25; p&#x25cb;</em> which with <em>na</em> = nevermore) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; further, moreover, besides ib. (also <em>punar aparam</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;dau-punar-pa&#x015b;c&#x0101;t</em>, at first-then-later) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; however, still, nevertheless MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c. (at the end of a verse it lays stress on a preceding <em>atha v&#x0101;</em>, <em>api v&#x0101;</em>, or <em>v&#x0101;</em> alone </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>punar api</em>, even again, on the other hand, also </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kad&#x0101; p&#x25cb;</em>, at any time, ever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kim p&#x25cb;</em>, how much more or less? however </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x1e6d;preceding-p&#x25cb;</em>, now-now </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at one time - at another time)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; punarapagama </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;apagama</em> m. going away again (<em>a</em>, <em>punar-ap&#x25cb;</em>) K&#x0101;m</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; m. a Karsha or measure of silver (= 16 Pa&#x1e47;as of cowries) Mn. viii, 136 (also n. L.) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the ancients MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. a thing or event of the past, an ancient tale or legend, old traditional history. AV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a class of sacred works (supposed to have been compiled by the poet Vy&#x0101;sa and to treat of 5 topics [cf. <em>pa&#x00f1;ca-lak&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the chief Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as are 18, grouped in 3 divisions: viz. 1. R&#x0101;jasa exalting Brahm&#x0101; [e.g. the Brahma, Brahm&#x00e2;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a, Brahmavaivarta, M&#x0101;rka&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;eya, Bhavishya, V&#x0101;mana] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 2. S&#x0101;ttvika exalting Vish&#x1e47;u [e.g. the Vish&#x1e47;u, Bh&#x0101;gavata, N&#x0101;radiya, Garu&#x1e0d;a, Padma, Var&#x0101;ha] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. T&#x0101;masa exalting Siva [e.g. the &#x015a;iva, Li&#x1e45;ga, Skanda, Agni or in place of it the V&#x0101;yu, Matsya, K&#x016b;rma] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; by some the Padma are divided into 4, and by others into 6 groups </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 509 &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of wk. (containing an index of the contents of a number of Padma and some other wks.)</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;havis</em> (<em>pur&#x00f3;-</em>), mfn. having the sacrifice in front or towards the east TS</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; purohita </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;hita</em> (<em>puro-</em>.), mfn. placed foremost or in front, charged, commissioned, appointed </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. one holding a charge or commission, an agent </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (esp.) a family priest, a domestic chaplain RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (RTL. 352 &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-karman</em> n. N. of 3rd Pari&#x015b;. of AV </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; purohitik&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;hitik&#x0101;</em> f. a favourite wife (cf. <em>puro-dhik&#x0101;</em>) or N. of a woman, g. <em>&#x015b;iv&#x00e2;di</em></dd>

           <dt>pur 3</dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x00fa;r</em> f. (in nom. sg. and before consonants <em>p&#x016b;r</em>) a rampart, wall, stronghold, fortress, castle, city, town (also of demons) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body (considered as the stronghold of the <em>puru&#x1e63;a</em>, q.v.) BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the intellect (= <em>mahat</em>) VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Da&#x015b;a-r&#x0101;tra K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. [Perhaps fr. &#x221a;<em>p&#x1e5d;</em> and orig. identical with 1. <em>pur</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a>, ?] [635, 2]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; pura </dt>
           <dd><em>pura</em> (for 1. See p. 634, col. 2), n. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) a fortress, castle, city, town (a place containing large buildings surrounded by a ditch and extending not less than one Kos in length <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p635-3"></a>[Page 635, Column 3]</font>
 ; if it extends for half that distance it is called a <em>khe&#x1e6d;a</em>, if less than that, a <em>karva&#x1e6d;a</em> or small market town ; any smaller cluster of houses is called a <em>gr&#x0101;ma</em> or village W.) Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the female apartments, gynaeceum MBh. (cf. <em>anta&#x1e25;-p&#x25cb;</em>, <em>n&#x0101;r&#x012b;-p&#x25cb;</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a house, abode, residence, receptacle BhP. Tattvas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an upper story L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a brothel L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'the city' Gk. ? i.e. P&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ali-putra or Patn&#x0101; L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>tri-pura</em>, the 3 strong holds of the Asuras Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body (cf. 3. <em>pur</em>) BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the skin L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a species of Cyperus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a constellation Var </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a leaf rolled into the shape of a funnel L. (prob. w&#x1e5b;. for <em>pu&#x1e6d;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the subdivisions of the Vedanta wk. <em>tripur&#x012b;</em> or <em>tripu&#x1e6d;&#x012b;</em> (perhaps also w&#x1e5b;. for <em>pu&#x1e6d;a</em>) Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. a kind of resin, bdellium, Susr. L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of an Asura= <em>tri-pura</em> (cf. <em>pura-jit</em>), of another man, g. <em>kurv-&#x0101;di</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a stronghold, fortress (cf. <em>agni-pur&#x0101;</em> and <em>a&#x015b;ma-p&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of perfume L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a fortress, castle, town T&#x0100;r. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a town (the capital of Kali&#x1e45;ga, noted for the worship of Jagan-n&#x0101;tha or K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a IW. 244, n. 1) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sanctuary or adytum of a temple Inscr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of one of the 10 orders of mendicants (said to be founded by disciples of &#x015a;a&#x1e43;kara, the members of which add the word <em>pur&#x012b;</em> to their names) W</dd>

           <dd><em>pu&#x1e63;</em> cl. 1. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup: xvii, 50) <em>po&#x1e63;ati</em> (trans.), only Nir. x, 34 ; cl. 4. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxvi, 73) <em>p&#x00fa;&#x1e63;yati</em> (trans. and intrans. ; m.c. also A. <em>&#x25cb;te</em>) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. ; cl. 9. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxi, 57) <em>pu&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x0101;ti</em> (trans.) MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c. (pf. <em>pup&#x00f3;&#x1e63;a</em>, <em>pupu&#x1e63;y&#x0101;s</em> RV. ; aor. <em>apu&#x1e63;at</em> or <em>apo&#x1e63;&#x012b;t</em> Gr. ; Pot. <em>pu&#x1e63;eyam</em>, RY. ; Prec. <em>pu&#x1e63;y&#x0101;sam</em>, <em>&#x25cb;sma</em> Br. ; fut. <em>po&#x1e63;i&#x1e63;yati</em>, <em>pok&#x1e63;yati</em> ;<em>po&#x1e63;it&#x0101;</em>, <em>po&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x0101;</em> Gr. ; Pass. <em>pu&#x1e63;yate</em> K&#x0101;v. ; sor. <em>apo&#x1e63;i</em> Gr. ; inf. <em>pu&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;se</em> RV.), to be nourished (with instr., e.g. <em>bh&#x0101;ryay&#x0101;</em> MBh. xiii, 4569), to thrive, flourish, prosper (also with <em>p&#x00f3;&#x1e63;am</em>, <em>pu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;im</em> or <em>v&#x1e5b;ddhim</em>) RV.            <dd>&#x2022; to cause to thrive or prosper, nourish, foster, augment, increase, further, promote, fulfil (e.g. a wish), develop, unfold, display, gain, obtain, enjoy, possess RV. &amp;c. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>posk&#x00e1;yati</em> (aor. <em>ap&#x016b;pu&#x1e63;at</em> Gr.), to rear, nourish, feed, cause to thrive or prosper RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a forest Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; calx of brass or green vitriol used as a collyrium L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a bracelet (esp. one of jewels) L </dd>

           <dt>p&#x016b;rva </dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x016b;&#x0341;rva</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (connected with <em>pur&#x0101;</em>, <em>puras</em>, <em>pra</em>, and declined like a pron. when implying relative position whether in place or time, but not necessarily in abl. loc. sg. m. n. and nom. pl. m </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; See P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-1, 27 ; 34 ; vii, 1, 16) being before or in front fore, first RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; eastern, to the east of (abl.) ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; former, prior, preceding, previous to, earlier than (abl. or comp.) ib. (<em>gaja-p&#x016b;rva</em>, preceding the number 'eight', i.e. seven, the seventh &#x015a;rutab </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x0101;sena p&#x25cb;</em>, or <em>m&#x0101;sa-p&#x25cb;</em>, earlier by a month P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-1, 31 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. often = formerly or before, e.g. <em>str&#x012b;-p&#x25cb;</em>, f&#x1e6d;formerly a wife </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;&#x1e0d;hya-p&#x25cb;</em>, formerly wealthy </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; esp. after a pp., e.g. <em>k&#x1e5b;ta-p&#x25cb;</em>, done before, <em>d&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a-p&#x25cb;</em>, seen before </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc. also preceded or accompanied by, attended with, e.g. <em>smita-p&#x016b;rv&#x0101;-v&#x0101;k</em>, speech accompanied by smiles </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes not translatable, e.g. <em>m&#x1e5b;du-p&#x016b;rv&#x0101; v&#x0101;k</em>, kind speech) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ancient, old, customary, traditional RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; first (in a series), initial, lowest (opp. to <em>uttara</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>dama</em> or <em>s&#x0101;hasa</em> 'the lowest fine') Mn. viii, 120 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>vayas</em>) 'first age', youth MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; foregoing, aforesaid, mentioned before (abl.) Mn. MBh. P&#x0101;&#x1e47; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. an ancestor, forefather (pl. the ancients, ancestors) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an elder brother R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a prince BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. (with or sc. <em>di&#x015b;</em>) the east MBh. R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a country to the east of Madhya-de&#x015b;a L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the Nakshatras P&#x016b;rva-phalgunt, P&#x016b;rv&#x00e2;sh&#x0101;&#x1e0d;h&#x0101; and P&#x016b;rvabhadrapad&#x0101; collectively Var </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. the fore part &#x015a;ak. ii, 4 (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 2-2, 1) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. high number (applied to a period of years) Buddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the most ancient of Jaina writings (of which 14 are enumerated) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Tantra Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an ancient tradition W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. before (also as a prep. with abl.), formerly, hitherto, previously (sometimes with pres.) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (often ibc., e.g. <em>p&#x016b;rva-k&#x0101;rin</em>, active before, <em>p&#x016b;rv&#x00f4;kta</em>, said before </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also ifc. in the sense of 'with', e.g. <em>pr&#x012b;ti-p&#x016b;rvam</em>, with love </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mati-p&#x016b;rvam</em> with intention, intentionally </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x1e5b;du-p&#x016b;rva-&#x221a;bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;</em>, to speak kindly </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#above">above.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also with an ind. p., e.g. <em>p&#x016b;rva-bhojam</em>, or <em>-bhuktv&#x0101;</em>, having eaten before P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-4, 24 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>adya-p&#x25cb;</em>, until now, hitherto </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; previously <em>-tata&#x1e25;</em>, first-then </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x016b;rva-pa&#x015b;c&#x0101;t</em>, previously-afterwards </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x016b;rva-upari</em>, previously-subsequently </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x016b;rva-adh&#x016b;n&#x0101;</em> or <em>adya</em>, formerly-now) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e&#x1e47;a</em>), ind. in front, before </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; eastward, to the east of (opp. to <em>apare&#x1e47;a</em>, with gen. or acc </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; p&#x016b;&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;vat </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;v&#x00e1;t</em> mfn. accompanied by P&#x016b;shan RV. VS. AitBr</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; p&#x016b;&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x016b;&#x1e63;&#x00e1;&#x1e47;a</em> m. N. of a god (= P&#x016b;shan) RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. N. of one of the M&#x0101;t&#x1e5b;is attending on Skanda MBh</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; p&#x016b;&#x1e63;an </dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x016b;&#x1e63;&#x00e1;n</em> m. (the <em>a</em> not lengthened in the strong cases, but acc. <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;&#x0101;&#x1e47;am</em>, in M&#x0101;rkP.) N. of a Vedic deity (originally connected with the sun, and therefore the surveyor of all things, and the conductor on journeys and on the way to the next world, often associated with Soma or the Moon as protector of the universe </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is, moreover, regarded as the keeper of flocks and herds and bringer of prosperity </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as he is represented as having lost his teeth and feeding on a kind of gruel, whence he is called <em>karambh&#x00e2;d</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in later times he is one of the 12 &#x0100;dityas and regent of the Nakshatra Revat&#x012b; or Paush&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; du. 'P&#x016b;shan and Aryaman' VP. Sch.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sun K&#x0101;d. B&#x0101;lar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (?) growth, increase (cf. <em>p&#x016b;&#x1e63;a-r&#x0101;ti</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the earth L</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; p&#x016b;&#x1e63;kara </dt>

           <dt>p&#x1e5b; 1</dt>
           <dd><em>p&#x1e5b;</em> cl. 3. P. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xxv, 4) <em>p&#x00ed;parti</em> (3. pl. <em>p&#x00ed;prati</em> RV </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; aor. Subj. <em>par&#x1e63;i</em>, <em>par&#x1e63;ati</em>, <em>par&#x1e63;a</em>, <em>p&#x0101;ri&#x1e63;at</em> RV. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p645-2"></a>[Page 645, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ap&#x0101;r&#x012b;t</em> Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>par&#x1e63;&#x00e1;&#x1e47;i</em> RV.), to bring over or to (acc.), bring out of, deliver from (abl.), rescue, save, protect, escort, further, promote RV. AV. VS. &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;. BhP. Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to surpass, excel (acc.) RV. viii, 50, 8 AV. xi, 5, 1 ; 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be able (with inf.) BhP.: Caus. <em>p&#x0101;r&#x00e1;yati</em> (ep. and m. c. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ap&#x012b;parat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>p&#x0101;ryate</em>), to bring over or out, rescue, protect, save, preserve, keep alive RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to get over, overcome, bring to an end ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to resist, withstand, be a match for (acc.) Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be capable of or able to (with an inf. which after <em>p&#x0101;ryate</em> has a pass. sense </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x221a;">&#x221a;.</a><em>&#x015b;ak</em> and P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-4, 66 Sch.) K&#x0101;v. Pur. &amp;c. [Cf. Gk. ? ; [645, 2] Lat. <em>porta</em>, <em>peritus</em> ; Slav. <em>pirati</em> ; Germ. <em>fahren</em> ; Eng. <em>fare</em>.]</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; having these Stotras (said of a partic. period of 6 sacrificial days <em>as subst. m.</em>, viz. <em>p&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hy&#x00e2;han</em>, <em>p&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hya-tryaha</em>, <em>-pa&#x00f1;c&#x00e2;ha</em>, <em>-stotriya</em>, <em>-caturtha</em>, <em>-&#x1e63;a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha</em> Vait.) </dd>

           <dd><em>py&#x0101;ta</em> (TS.) or (Gr.), mfn. fat, swollen (= <em>p&#x012b;na</em>)</dd>

           <dd><em>py&#x0101;na</em> (Gr.), mfn. fat, swollen (= <em>p&#x012b;na</em>)</dd>

           <dt>pra 1</dt>
           <dd><em>pr&#x00e1;</em> ind. before </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; forward, in front, on, forth (mostly in connection with a verb, esp. with a verb of motion which is often to be supplied </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes repeated before the verb, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 8-1, 6 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely as a separate word, e.g. AitBr. ii, 40) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as a prefix to subst. = forth, away, cf. <em>pra-v&#x1e5b;tti</em>, <em>pra-sth&#x0101;na</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as pref. to adj. = excessively, very, much, cf. <em>pra-ca&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a</em>, <em>pra-matta</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in nouns of relationship = great-, cf. <em>pra-pit&#x0101;maha</em>, <em>pra-pautra</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ('according to native lexicographers it may be used in the senses of <em>gati</em>, <em>&#x0101;-rambha</em>, <em>ut-kar&#x1e63;a</em>, <em>sarvato-bh&#x0101;va</em>, <em>pr&#x0101;thamya</em>, <em>khy&#x0101;ti</em>, <em>ut-patti</em>, <em>vy-avah&#x0101;ra</em>) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. [Cf. <em>puras</em>, <em>pur&#x0101;</em>, <em>p&#x016b;rva</em> ; Zd. <em>fra</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>pro</em> ; Slav. <em>pra-</em>, <em>pro-</em> ; Lith. <em>pra-</em> ; [652, 2] Goth. <em>fa&#x00fa;r</em>, <em>fa&#x00fa;ra</em> ; Germ. <em>vor</em> ; Eng. <em>fore</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>pra 2</dt>
           <dd><em>pra</em> mfn. (&#x221a;<em>p&#x1e5d;</em> or <em>pr&#x0101;</em>) filling, fulfilling </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (n. fulfilment, ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>&#x0101;k&#x016b;ti-</em>, <em>kak&#x1e63;ya-</em>, <em>k&#x0101;ma-</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; like, resembling (ifc </dd>

           <dd><em>pra-&#x221a;k&#x0101;&#x015b;</em> &#x0100;. <em>-k&#x0101;&#x015b;ate</em> (ep. also P. <em>&#x25cb;t&#x012b;</em>), to become visible, appear, shine, become evident or manifest Up.            <dt>&#x22d9; prak&#x0101;&#x015b;a </dt>
           <dd><em>pra-&#x1e0d;k&#x0101;&#x015b;a</em> mfn. visible, shining, bright &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khBr. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; clear, manifest, open, public Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (<em>n&#x0101;madheyam prak&#x0101;&#x015b;a&#x1e43; k&#x1e5b;tv&#x0101;</em>, 'pronouncing a name out loud' &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; expanded W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; universally noted, famous, celebrated for (instr. or comp.) MBh. K&#x0101;lid </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; renowned throughout (comp.) Ragh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) having the appearance of, looking like, resembling MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ibc. and (<em>am</em>), ind. openly, publicly, before the eyes of all Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (<em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;a&#x1e43; n&#x00e2;bhyudaik&#x1e63;ata</em>, 'he did not look up openly' R.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aloud, audibly (esp. in dram., opp. to <em>&#x0101;tma-gatam</em>, <em>sva-gatam</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. clearness, brightness, splendour, lustre, light RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (fig.) light, elucidation, explanation (esp. at the end of titles of explanatory works, e.g. <em>k&#x0101;vya-</em>, <em>tarka-</em> &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; appearance, display. manifestation, expansion, diffusion MBh. K&#x0101;v. S&#x0101;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; publicity, fame, renown, glory Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sunshine open spot or air MBh. &#x015a;ak. M&#x0101;rkP. (<em>e</em> ind. openly, publicly, before the world, ifc. in the presence of MBh. Prab.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the gloss on the upper part of a (horse's) body VS. (Mah&#x012b;dh) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; w&#x1e5b;. for <em>pr&#x0101;k&#x25cb;</em> TBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a chapter, section, Cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of sev. wks. ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; laughter L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a Br&#x0101;hman (son of Tamas) MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Manu Raivata Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) the messengers of Vish&#x1e47;u L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. bell-metal, brass L </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; prak&#x1e5b;ti </dt>
           <dd><em>pra-k&#x1e5b;ti</em> f. 'making or placing before or at first', the original or natural form or condition of anything, original or primary substance (opp. to <em>vi-k&#x1e5b;ti</em>, q.v.) Pr&#x0101;t. Nir. Jaim. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cause original source Mn. MBh. &#x015a;ak. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; origin, extraction M&#x1e5b;icch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; nature, character, constitution, temper, disposition MBh. K&#x0101;v. Su&#x015b;r. &amp;c. (ibc. and <em>&#x25cb;ty&#x0101;</em> ind. by nature, naturally, unalterably, properly Pr&#x0101;t. &#x015a;rS. Mn. &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fundamental form, pattern, standard, model, rule (esp. in ritual) &#x015a;rS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in the S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya phil.) the original producer of (or rather passive power of creating) the material world (consisting of 3 constituent essences or Gu&#x1e47;as called <em>sattva</em>, <em>rajas</em> and <em>tamas</em>), Nature (distinguished from <em>puru&#x1e63;a</em>, Spirit as M&#x0101;y&#x0101; is distinguished from Brahman in the Ved&#x00e2;ntas) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. the 8 producers or primary essences which evolve the whole visible world (viz. <em>a-vyakta</em>, <em>buddhi</em> or <em>mahat</em>, <em>aha&#x1e43;-k&#x0101;ra</em>, and the 5 <em>tan-m&#x0101;tras</em> or subtle elements </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely the 5 elements alone) IW. 80 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in mythol.) a goddess, the personified will of the Supreme in the creation (hence the same with the &#x015a;akti or personified energy or wife of a deity, as Lakshm&#x012b;, Durg&#x0101; &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also considered as identical with the Supreme Being) W. IW. 140 <strong>RTL. 223</strong> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (pl.) N. of a class of deities under Manu Raibhya Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in polit.) pl. a king's ministers, the body of ministers or counsellors, ministry Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the subjects of a king, citizens, artisans &amp;c. ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the constituent elements or powers of the state (of which are usually enumerated, viz. king minister, alies, treasure, army, territory, fortresses Mn. ix, 294 ; 295) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the various sovereigns to be considered in case of war (viz. the <em>madhyama</em>, <em>vijig&#x012b;&#x1e63;u</em>, <em>ud&#x0101;s&#x012b;na</em> and <em>&#x015b;atru</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to which should be added 8 remoter princes, viz. the <em>mitra</em>, <em>arimitra</em>, <em>mitra-mitra</em>, <em>arimitra-mitra</em>, <em>p&#x0101;r&#x1e63;&#x1e47;i-graha</em>, <em>&#x0101;kranda</em>, <em>p&#x0101;r&#x1e63;&#x1e47;igr&#x0101;h&#x00e2;s&#x0101;ra</em>, <em>&#x0101;krand&#x00e2;s&#x0101;sa</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; each of these 12 kings has 5 Prak&#x1e5b;itis in the form of minister, territory, fortresses, treasure and army, so that the total number of Prak&#x1e5b;itis may be 72) Mn. vii, 155 ; 157 Kull </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) the crude or elementary form of a word, base, &#x221a;, an uninflected word S&#x0101;h. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Sch. Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of 2 classes of metres Col </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in arithm.) a co-efficient multiplier ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in anat.) temperament, the predominance of one of the humours at the time of generation W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>trit&#x012b;y&#x0101;</em>) the third nature, a eunuch MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; matter, affair Lalit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the male or female organ of generation L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a woman or womankind L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a mother L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an animal L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a woman Buddh </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; praj&#x0101;pati </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pati</em> (<em>&#x25cb;j&#x0101;-</em>), m. 'lord of creatures', N. of Savit&#x1e5b;i, Soma, Agni, Indra &amp;c. RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a divinity presiding over procreation, protector of life ib. VS. Mn. Su&#x015b;r. BhP. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p658-3"></a>[Page 658, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; lord of creatures, creator RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (N. of a supreme god above or among the Vedic deities [RV. (only x, 21, 10) AV. VS. Br.] but in later times also applied to Vish&#x1e47;u, &#x015a;iva, Time personified, the sun, fire, &amp;c., and to various progenitors, esp. to the 10 lords of created beings first created by Brahm&#x0101;, viz. Mar&#x012b;ci, Atri, A&#x1e45;giras, Pulastya, Pulaka, Kratu, Vasish&#x1e6d;ha, Pracetas or Daksha, Bh&#x1e5b;igu, N&#x0101;rada [Mn.i, 34 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#IW">IW.</a> 206, n. 1], of whom some authorities count only the first 7, others the last 3) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a species of insect L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-carita</em> n. N. of wk </dd>

           <dt>prati 1</dt>
           <dd><em>pr&#x00e1;ti</em> ind. (as a prefix to roots and their derivative nouns and other nouns, sometimes <em>prat&#x012b;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; for 2. See p, 664) towards, near to </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; against, in opposition to </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; back, again, in return </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; down upon, upon, on </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; before nouns it expresses also likeness or comparison (cf. <em>prati-candra</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or it forms Avyayibh&#x0101;vas of different kinds (cf. <em>prati-k&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;am</em>, <em>prati-graham</em>, <em>praty-agni</em> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely ifc. e.g. <em>s&#x016b;paprati</em>, a little broth P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-1, 9) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or as a prep. with usually preceding acc., in the sense of towards, against, to, upon, in the direction of (e.g. <em>&#x015b;abdam p&#x25cb;</em>, in the dir&#x1e6d;direction of the sound R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>agnim pr&#x25cb;</em>, against the fire Mn </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also <em>praty-agni</em> ind. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 6-2, 33 Sch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ripum pr&#x25cb;</em>, against the enemy Mn </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;tm&#x0101;nam pr&#x25cb;</em>, to one's self Ratn&#x00e2;v.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; opposite, before, in the presence of (e.g. <em>rodas&#x012b; pr&#x25cb;</em>, bef&#x1e6d;before heaven and earth RV.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in comparison, on a par with, in proportion to (e.g. <em>indram pr&#x25cb;</em>, in compar&#x1e6d;comparison with little RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>sahasr&#x0101;&#x1e47;i pr&#x25cb;</em>, on a par with i.e. equivalent to thousands ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also with abl. or <em>-tas</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-4, 92 ; ii, 3, 11) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the vicinity of, near, beside, at, on (e.g. <em>y&#x016b;pam pr&#x25cb;</em>, near the sacrificial post AitBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ga&#x1e45;g&#x0101;m pr&#x25cb;</em>, at or on the Ganges R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>etat pr&#x25cb;</em>, at this point TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;yodhanam pr&#x25cb;</em>, on the field of battle MBh.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the time of, about, through, for (e.g. <em>ph&#x0101;lgunam pr&#x25cb;</em>, about the month Ph&#x0101;lguna Mn </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ciram pr&#x25cb;</em>, for a long time MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x1e5b;&#x015b;am pr&#x25cb;</em>, often, repeatedly Car.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or used distributively (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 90) to express at every, in or on every, severally (e.g. <em>yaj&#x00f1;am pr&#x25cb;</em>, at every sacrifice Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yaj&#x00f1;a&#x1e43; yaj&#x00f1;am pr&#x25cb;</em> TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>var&#x1e63;am pr&#x25cb;</em>, every year, anually Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in this sense often comp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#above">above.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in favour of, for (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 90 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. <em>p&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;av&#x0101;n pr&#x25cb;</em>, in favour of the P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. MBh.) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p661-3"></a>[Page 661, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; on account of, with regard to, concerning (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. ib., e.g. <em>s&#x012b;m&#x0101;m pr&#x25cb;</em>, conc&#x1e6d;concerning a boundary Mn </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>gautamam pr&#x25cb;</em>, with reg&#x1e6d;regard to Ganges R.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; conformably or according to (e.g. <em>m&#x0101;m pr&#x25cb;</em>, according to me, i.e. in my opinion M&#x0101;lav </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>m&#x0101;m praty ara&#x1e47;yavat pratibh&#x0101;ti</em>, 'it seems to me like a forest' Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na bubhuk&#x1e63;itam prati bh&#x0101;ti ki&#x1e43; cit</em>, 'to a hungry man nothing is of any account' K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-3, 2) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as, for (after a verb meaning, to regard or consider' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vikr">Vikr.</a> iv, 69) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or as prep. with abl. in return or as compensation for, instead or in the place of (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 92 Sch.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with abl. or <em>-tas</em> See above </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with abl. or gen. (?) to express, 'about', 'at the time of' (only <em>pr&#x1e6d;prati vasto&#x1e25;</em>', at daybreak' RV.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as prep. with gen. = with reference to Hariv. 10967. [Cf. Zd. <em>paiti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ?, ?, ?.] [661, 3]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; pratik&#x016b;la </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x016b;la</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. 'against the bank' (opp. to <em>anu-k&#x016b;la</em>, q.v.), contrary, adverse, opposite, inverted, wrong, refractory, inimical, disagreeable, unpleasant Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>k&#x016b;&#x0341;lam</em>), ind. contrarily, against, in inverted order AV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. inverted order, opposition </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ena</em>, in inv&#x1e6d;inverted order BhP </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>v&#x0101;kyam</em> and gen. 'to promise fulfilment of a person's word' MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>satyam</em> 'to promise verily or truly' ib.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;) to confirm, assert, answer in the affirmative &#x015a;Br. &#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to maintain, assert, allege, state MBh. R. &amp;c. (<em>&#x015b;abda&#x1e43; nityatvena</em>, 'to assert the eternity of sound' P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 22 Sch.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;) to bring forward or introduce (a topic) Ny&#x0101;yam. Sch </dd>

           <dt>prat&#x012b; 2</dt>
           <dd><em>prat&#x012b;7</em> (<em>prati-&#x221a;i</em>), P. <em>praty-eti</em>, to go towards or against, go to meet (as friend or foe) RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to come back, return ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to resort or apply to RV. AV. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fall to a person's (dat.) lot or share AitBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to receive, accept MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also Pass.) to admit, recognize, be certain of, be convinced that (2 acc.) G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS. Nir. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to trust, believe (with gen.) Kath&#x0101;s.: Pass. <em>prat&#x012b;7yate</em>, to be admitted or recognized, follow, result K&#x0101;v. &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k. Hit. (p. <em>&#x25cb;yam&#x0101;na</em>, known, understood, implicit P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. S&#x0101;h.): Caus. <em>praty-&#x0101;yayati</em> (Pass. <em>praty-&#x0101;yyate</em>), to lead towards i.e. cause to recognize or acknowledge, convince (any one of the truth of anything) K&#x0101;lid </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to make clear, prove &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k. S&#x0101;h.: Desid. <em>prat&#x012b;7&#x1e63;i&#x1e63;ati</em>, to wish or try to understand P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-4, 47 Sch</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; prat&#x012b;ta </dt>
           <dd><em>prat&#x012b;7ta</em> mfn. acknow. ledged, recognized, known (<em>&#x015b;y&#x0101;maiti</em>, 'by the name of &#x015a;a&#x1e43;k') Nir. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; convinced of anything, trusting in, firmly resolved upon (comp.) Ka&#x1e6d;hUp. MBh. Hit </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; pratyaya </dt>
           <dd><em>pratyaya</em> m. belief firm conviction, trust, faith, assurance or certainty of (gen., loc. or comp.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; proof, ascertainment Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (<em>pratyaya&#x1e43;-&#x221a;gam</em>, to acquire confidence, repose confidence in MBh </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x0101;rin</em> mfn. id. L </dd>

           <dt>prath 1</dt>
           <dd><em>prath</em> cl. 1. &#x0100;. (Dh&#x0101;tup. xix, 3) <em>pr&#x00e1;thate</em> (rarely P. <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> e.g. impf. 2. du. <em>&#x00e1;prathatam</em> RV </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>prathi&#x1e63;yate</em>, <em>prathit&#x0101;</em> Gr.), to spread, extend (intrans </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; P. trans. and intrans.), become larger or wider, increase RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to spread abroad (as a name, rumour &amp;c.), become known or celebrated MBh. K&#x0101;v. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to come to light, appear, arise Kir. R&#x0101;jat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to occur (to the mind) R&#x0101;jat.: Caus. <em>prath&#x00e1;yati</em> (rarely <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>apaprathat</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-4, 95 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. <em>papr&#x00e1;that</em> RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>paprathanta</em> ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pr&#x00e1;thayi</em> TS.), to spread, extend, increase RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>prathayati-tar&#x0101;m</em> Ratn&#x00e2;v. iv, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. intr. RV. AV.) </dd>

           <dt>prathama </dt>
           <dd><em>pratham&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>)n. (for <em>pra-tama</em>, superl. of 1. <em>pra</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely declined as a pron., e.g. <em>&#x25cb;m&#x00e1;sy&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em> AV. vi, 18, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;me</em> Pa&#x00f1;cavBr. xxv, 18, 5 R. iv, 37, 11 Kir. ii, 44 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-1, 33) foremost, first (in time or in a series or in rank) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; earliest, primary, original, prior, former </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; preceding, initial, chief, principal, most excellent RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; often translatable adverbially = ibc. (cf. below) and (<em>&#x00e1;m</em>), ind. firstly, at first, for the first time </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; just, newly, at once, forthwith (also <em>&#x0101;t</em> Hariv.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; formerly, previously (<em>am</em> also as prep. with gen. = before, e.g. Mn. ii, 194 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>prathamam-anantaram</em>, or <em>pa&#x015b;c&#x0101;t</em>, first-afterwards </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>pr&#x1e6d;prathamam-tatas</em>, firstnext) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (in gram., scil. <em>var&#x1e47;a</em>), the first consonant of a Varga, a surd unaspirate letter </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (scil. <em>puru&#x1e63;a</em>), the first (= our 3rd) person or its terminations </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (scil. <em>svara</em>), the first tone </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in math. the sum of the products divided by the difference between the squares of the cosine of the azimuth and the sine of the amplitude </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. (in gram.) the first or nominative case and its terminations <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p679-1"></a>[Page 679, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; du. the first two cases and their terminations</dd>

           <dd><em>pra-dak&#x1e63;i&#x1e47;a</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. moving to the right &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; standing or placed on the right (with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, or <em>pra-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, 'to turn towards persons or things so as to place them on one's right', 'turn the right side towards' as a token of respect) Mn.            <dt>prad&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>pra-d&#x0101;</em> &#x221a;1. P. <em>-dad&#x0101;ti</em>, rarely &#x0100;. <em>-datte</em>, (Ved. inf. <em>pr&#x00e1;-d&#x0101;tos</em> TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; irreg. Pot. P. <em>-dadet</em> Hcat.), to give away, give, offer, present, grant, bestow RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (with or scil. <em>bh&#x0101;ry&#x0101;m</em>, to give in marriage </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>prativacas</em>, to grant an answer </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>prav&#x1e5b;ttim</em>, to information about an event </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>yuddham</em>, to grant battle </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>dva&#x1e43;dva-yuddham</em>, to engage in single combat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>vidy&#x0101;m</em>, to communicate or impart knowledge </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>hut&#x00e2;&#x015b;anam</em>, to set fire to) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to give up, abolish TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to sell (with instr. of price) Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to restore (anything lost &amp;c.) Mn </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to pay, discharge (a debt) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to put or place in (loc.) ib. MBh.: Pass. <em>-d&#x012b;yate</em>, to be given away, be given Mn. MBh. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>-d&#x0101;payati</em>, to cause to give TS. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to compel to give back or to repay Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. Kull. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p679-3"></a>[Page 679, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause to put in or to MBh. Bhpr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to put or place in (loc.) Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>vastim</em>), to apply a clyster ib.: Desid. <em>-ditsate</em>, to wish to give in marriage Da&#x015b;</dd>

           <dt>prabhra&#x1e43;&#x015b; </dt>
